description.zh-cn: 由中国、朝鲜、日本、韩国、俄罗斯、美国六国共同参与，旨在解决朝鲜核问题的一系列谈判。
description.en: A series of multilateral negotiations held intermittently since 2003 and attended by China, North Korea, Japan, South Korea, Russia, and the United States for the purpose of dismantling North Korea's nuclear program.

description.zh-cn: 指朝鲜民主主义人民共和国开发核武器而引发的国际外交和安全问题。
description.en: Refers to the international diplomatic and security issues arising from the Democratic People's Republic of Korea's development of nuclear weapons.

description.zh-cn: 六方会谈的参与国之一，并担任会议的主办方和斡旋方。
description.en: One of the participating countries in the Six-Party Talks, serving as the host and mediator of the meetings.

description.en: One of the participating countries in the Six-Party Talks, whose nuclear program is the central issue of the negotiations.

description.en: One of the participating countries in the Six-Party Talks.

description.zh-cn: 因《朝美核框架协议》执行失败，朝鲜宣布重启核计划而引发的国际危机。
description.en: An international crisis triggered by North Korea's announcement to restart its nuclear program following the failure of the Agreed Framework.

description.zh-cn: 美国与朝鲜于1994年签署的关于朝鲜核问题的协议，其未能得到执行导致了第二次朝核危机。
description.en: An agreement signed in 1994 between the United States and North Korea regarding the North Korean nuclear issue, the failure of which led to the second nuclear crisis.

en: Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons

description.zh-cn: 旨在防止核武器和武器技术扩散、促进和平利用核能的国际条约。
description.en: An international treaty whose objective is to prevent the spread of nuclear weapons and weapons technology, and to promote cooperation in the peaceful uses of nuclear energy.

description.zh-cn: 美国第43任总统，其政府在第二次朝核危机初期寻求中国斡旋，推动了六方会谈的开启。
description.en: The 43rd President of the United States, whose administration sought Chinese mediation at the beginning of the second North Korean nuclear crisis, which promoted the start of the Six-Party Talks.

description.zh-cn: 时任美国国务卿，于2003年2月访问中国，请求中方出面斡旋朝鲜核问题。
description.en: Then U.S. Secretary of State, who visited China in February 2003 to request Chinese mediation on the North Korean nuclear issue.

description.zh-cn: 时任中华人民共和国副主席，会见了来访的美国国务卿鲍威尔。
description.en: Then Vice President of the People's Republic of China, who met with the visiting U.S. Secretary of State Colin Powell.

nodes.id: 第四轮六方会谈共同声明

zh-cn: 第四轮六方会谈共同声明
en: Joint Statement of the Fourth Round of the Six-Party Talks

description.zh-cn: 六方会谈达成的第一份共同声明，朝鲜首次承诺放弃一切核武器及现有核计划。
description.en: The first joint statement reached in the Six-Party Talks, in which North Korea for the first time committed to abandoning all nuclear weapons and existing nuclear programs.

en: United States Department of the Treasury

description.zh-cn: 美国政府部门，曾以涉嫌为朝鲜洗钱为由制裁澳门汇业银行，对六方会谈进程造成重大影响。
description.en: A department of the U.S. government that sanctioned Banco Delta Asia for alleged money laundering for North Korea, significantly impacting the Six-Party Talks process.

description.zh-cn: 位于澳门的银行，因被美国指控为朝鲜洗钱而受到制裁，成为六方会谈的争议焦点之一。
description.en: A Macau-based bank that was sanctioned by the United States for alleged money laundering for North Korea, becoming a point of contention in the Six-Party Talks.

description.zh-cn: 朝鲜首次进行的地下核试验，导致联合国安理会通过制裁决议。
description.en: North Korea's first underground nuclear test, which led to the adoption of a sanctions resolution by the UN Security Council.

description.zh-cn: 联合国的主要机构之一，曾多次通过决议谴责和制裁朝鲜的核试验与导弹发射活动。
description.en: One of the principal organs of the United Nations, which has passed multiple resolutions condemning and sanctioning North Korea's nuclear tests and missile launch activities.

description.zh-cn: 针对2006年朝鲜核试验通过的决议，对朝鲜实施了多项制裁。
description.en: A resolution adopted in response to the 2006 North Korean nuclear test, imposing various sanctions on North Korea.

nodes.id: 落实共同声明起步行动

zh-cn: 落实共同声明起步行动
en: Initial Actions for the Implementation of the Joint Statement

description.zh-cn: 第五轮六方会谈第三阶段会议通过的文件，规划了落实《9·19共同声明》的初步行动。
description.en: A document adopted at the third session of the fifth round of the Six-Party Talks, outlining initial actions for the implementation of the September 19 Joint Statement.

nodes.id: 落实共同声明第二阶段行动

zh-cn: 落实共同声明第二阶段行动
en: Second-Phase Actions for the Implementation of the Joint Statement

description.zh-cn: 第六轮六方会谈第二阶段会议通过的文件，规定了朝鲜核设施“去功能化”和“申报”的具体要求。
description.en: A document adopted at the second session of the sixth round of the Six-Party Talks, which specified requirements for the disablement and declaration of North Korea's nuclear facilities.

description.zh-cn: 韩国前总统，其对朝鲜的强硬政策被认为是导致局势恶化的因素之一。
description.en: Former President of South Korea, whose hardline policy towards North Korea is considered a factor in the deterioration of the situation.

description.zh-cn: 美国第44任总统，其政府对朝鲜推行“战略忍耐”政策。
description.en: The 44th President of the United States, whose administration pursued a policy of 'strategic patience' towards North Korea.

description.zh-cn: 朝鲜于2009年发射的试验通信卫星，此次发射引发国际社会谴责，并直接导致朝鲜宣布退出六方会谈。
description.en: An experimental communications satellite launched by North Korea in 2009. The launch drew international condemnation and directly led to North Korea's announcement of its withdrawal from the Six-Party Talks.

description.zh-cn: 朝鲜前最高领导人，六方会谈期间朝鲜的主要决策者。
description.en: Former supreme leader of North Korea and the main decision-maker for North Korea during the Six-Party Talks.

description.zh-cn: 朝鲜现任最高领导人，于2011年12月在其父金正日去世后接班。
description.en: The current supreme leader of North Korea, who succeeded his father Kim Jong-il after his death in December 2011.

description.zh-cn: 时任日本外相，于2018年宣布对六方会谈弃核失败的原委展开调查。
description.en: Then Foreign Minister of Japan, who announced in 2018 an investigation into the reasons for the failure of the Six-Party Talks to achieve denuclearization.

description.zh-cn: 六方会谈旨在通过多边谈判和平解决朝鲜核问题。
description.en: The Six-Party Talks aimed to peacefully resolve the North Korean nuclear issue through multilateral negotiations.

description.zh-cn: 中国是六方会谈的参与国，并作为东道主和斡旋方发挥了关键作用。
description.en: China was a participant in the Six-Party Talks and played a key role as the host and mediator.

relationships.source: 朝鲜民主主义人民共和国

description.zh-cn: 朝鲜是六方会谈的核心参与国，其核计划是会谈的主要议题。朝鲜于2009年4月14日宣布退出会谈。
description.en: North Korea was a core participant in the Six-Party Talks, with its nuclear program being the main topic. North Korea announced its withdrawal from the talks on April 14, 2009.

description.zh-cn: 日本是六方会谈的参与国之一。
description.en: Japan was one of the participating countries in the Six-Party Talks.

description.zh-cn: 韩国是六方会谈的参与国之一。
description.en: South Korea was one of the participating countries in the Six-Party Talks.

description.zh-cn: 俄罗斯是六方会谈的参与国之一。
description.en: Russia was one of the participating countries in the Six-Party Talks.

description.zh-cn: 美国是六方会谈的参与国之一。
description.en: The United States was one of the participating countries in the Six-Party Talks.

description.zh-cn: 《朝美核框架协议》未能得到执行，导致美朝关系破裂，并直接引发了第二次朝核危机。
description.en: The failure to implement the Agreed Framework led to the breakdown of US-DPRK relations and directly triggered the Second North Korean nuclear crisis.

relationships.source: 朝鲜民主主义人民共和国

description.zh-cn: 2003年1月10日，朝鲜宣布退出《不扩散核武器条约》。
description.en: On January 10, 2003, North Korea announced its withdrawal from the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons.

description.zh-cn: 2003年2月，时任美国国务卿鲍威尔访问中国，与时任中国国家副主席胡锦涛会面，请求中方斡旋朝鲜核问题。
description.en: In February 2003, then U.S. Secretary of State Powell visited China and met with then Chinese Vice President Hu Jintao to request Chinese mediation on the North Korean nuclear issue.

description.zh-cn: 应美国请求，中国政府决定出面斡旋，并主办了旨在解决朝鲜核问题的三方及后续的六方会谈。
description.en: At the request of the United States, the Chinese government decided to mediate and hosted the three-party and subsequent six-party talks aimed at resolving the North Korean nuclear issue.

relationships.target: 第四轮六方会谈共同声明

description.zh-cn: 2005年9月19日，第四轮六方会谈第二阶段会议通过了《9·19共同声明》，这是六方会谈达成的第一份共同声明。
description.en: On September 19, 2005, the second session of the fourth round of the Six-Party Talks adopted the September 19 Joint Statement, the first joint statement reached in the talks.

relationships.target: 朝鲜民主主义人民共和国

description.zh-cn: 美国财政部指责澳门汇业银行替朝鲜洗钱并实施制裁，冻结了朝鲜在该行的资金，对六方会谈进程造成了严重阻碍。
description.en: The U.S. Treasury Department accused Banco Delta Asia of money laundering for North Korea and imposed sanctions, freezing North Korean funds in the bank, which severely hampered the Six-Party Talks process.

description.zh-cn: 朝鲜于2006年10月9日进行的首次核试验，促使联合国安理会于10月14日一致通过第1718号决议，对朝鲜进行制裁。
description.en: North Korea's first nuclear test on October 9, 2006, prompted the UN Security Council to unanimously adopt Resolution 1718 on October 14, imposing sanctions on North Korea.

description.zh-cn: 朝鲜发射“光明星2号”卫星后，联合国安理会通过主席声明予以谴责，朝鲜随后于4月14日宣布退出六方会谈。
description.en: After North Korea launched the 'Kwangmyŏngsŏng-2' satellite, the UN Security Council issued a presidential statement condemning it, and North Korea subsequently announced its withdrawal from the Six-Party Talks on April 14.

relationships.source: 朝鲜民主主义人民共和国

description.zh-cn: 2009年4月14日，朝鲜外务省发表声明，宣布退出六方会谈并将重启核设施建设。
description.en: On April 14, 2009, the North Korean Foreign Ministry issued a statement announcing its withdrawal from the Six-Party Talks and its intention to restart nuclear facilities.

description.zh-cn: 金正恩是金正日的小儿子，并在其父去世后成为朝鲜最高领导人。
description.en: Kim Jong-un is the youngest son of Kim Jong-il and became the supreme leader of North Korea after his father's death.

description.zh-cn: 2018年5月，时任日本外相河野太郎宣布对六方会谈弃核失败的原委展开调查，间接承认了会谈的失败。
description.en: In May 2018, then Japanese Foreign Minister Taro Kono announced an investigation into the reasons for the failure of the Six-Party Talks to achieve denuclearization, indirectly acknowledging the failure of the talks.
